byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, Raphael Minder, Colin Moynihan and Nate Schweber. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

abstract: Residents of the Bronx Boulevard Men's Shelter mourn Ana Charle, shelter's director who was murdered by one of their own; describe Charle as person with heart of gold who dedicated herself to others; murder suspect West Spruill undergoes hearing, as many in homeless services system fear heinous act will overshadow needs of people who are seriously mentally ill.
lead_paragraph: Ana Charle, director of the Bronx Boulevard Men’s Shelter, was shot to death Monday night, and a shelter resident, West Spruill, was charged.

headline.main: Police Describe Ex-Resident’s Calculated Plan to Attack Bronx Homeless Shelter’s Director
headline.print_headline: Tears and Shock Over Killing of Shelter Director With ‘Heart of Gold’

snippet: Ana Charle, director of the Bronx Boulevard Men’s Shelter, was shot to death Monday night, and a shelter resident, West Spruill, was charged.
